data.title: World Editions
data.meta_description: Subscribe to the World Editions mailing list to keep up to date with our latest publications, news, and events.
data.text:
World Editions Welcomes Robin (Shimanto) Reza as Editorial Director!

World Editions is thrilled to welcome a new Editorial Director! Robin (Shimanto) Reza did his internship with World Editions in 2018, and has been part of the editorial team ever since. In addition...

Continue reading

5 National Book Award Honorees in 5 Years!

We are absolutely thrilled to announce that Pilar Quintana's Abyss, translated from the Spanish by Lisa Dillman and published by World Editions, has been named a FINALIST for the 2023 National Book Aw...

Continue reading

World Editions US is Turning 5!

World Editions is turning 5 and we are celebrating! World Editions launched in the US in 2018. Our first two books, Always Another Country by Sisonke Msimang and You Have Me to Love by Jaap Robben ...

Continue reading

World Editions is now a fully independent publisher

After five years of being part of the Libella Publishing Group, international literature publisher World Editions announces a new structure as a fully independent publishing house. The company, whi...

Continue reading

Special London event with Lucie Rico and her translator Daria Chernysheva, 30 June!

Don’t miss this London event to launch Rico’s novel Fowl Eulogies, published in English translation by World Editions at UCL on 30 June! In this ‘dazzling first novel of malice and feathers’ (Elle)...

Continue reading

Ian McEwan praises Marijke Schermer’s Breakwater, just published in English translation

This spring saw publication of acclaimed Dutch author Marijke Schermer’s Breakwater, translated into English by Liz Waters Ian McEwan has called it an ‘excellent novel.’ He describes it as ‘Packed...

Continue reading

Second London event with Pilar Quintana in conversation with Julianne Pachico at Burley Fisher books

We’re excited to announce a second London event with National-Book Award nominated author Pilar Quintana. She’ll be in conversation with Julianne Pachico talking about her new novel, Abyss, at Burley...

Continue reading

Chinese author Zhang Yueran to visit UK in May 2023 with her translator Jeremy Tiang

Described by Ian McEwan as ‘ a triumph’ , this story of friendship, trauma, family secrets and the aftermath of the Cultural Revolution caught the imagination of reviewers and readers everywhere. Y...

Pilar Quintana, author of Abyss, visits the UK, June 2023

Colombian author Pilar Quintana, shortlisted for the National Book Award for her novel The Bitch, will be in the UK in May and June to launch her new novel, Abyss, translated from the Spanish by Lisa ...

Maryse Condé’s The Gospel According to the New World longlisted for Booker International

We are delighted to announce that award-winning author Maryse Condé has been longlisted for the International Booker Prize for the first time. Her new novel, The Gospel According to the New World, ...
